summary: The Make America's Youth Healthy Again Act of 2025 proposes the re-establishment of the President’s Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition. The Council will advise the President on strategies to improve youth fitness and nutrition, including re-establishing the Presidential Fitness Test, expanding sports participation, and addressing the national security threat posed by childhood obesity. The Council is limited to 30 members appointed by the President who will recommend programs, campaigns and events. The Council will terminate two years after the Act's enactment unless extended by the President.
